meaningMnemonic: The amount of <radical>dirt</radical> you need to get some <radical>peace</radical> is a <kanji>two mat area</kanji>. Two tatami mats, that is. Also called a <kanji>tsubo</kanji>, this is a pretty common measurement in Japan, so you should get really familiar with the amount of space that two tatami mats take up together.
readingMnemonic: A <kanji>two mat area</kanji> also happens to be big enough to hold <reading>two bo</reading>dies (つぼ). That's enough space to bring peace to two living, or dead, bodies!
